page.title: 02Housing - Newton/Dunham area
page.content: Housing standards are generally high. Flats and one bedroomed bungalows have been built for rent by the Council for the elderly. These have replaced substandard cottages. Some think the style of these new dwellings is not in tune with the environment externally but attractive internally. A number of new detached and semi-detached houses are being built for the home buyer.There is a tendency to renovate old property with the help of grants from the council. Renting houses from private landlords is becoming less popular. As the houses become empty landlords sell. House prices are stable. A three bed semidetached house is priced around Â£25,OOO. Heating is by oil or solid fuel. Lighting and power is by electricity. There is no gas in the area. All houses have gardens.
